alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Chaffee County through 345 PM MDT... At 311 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms over the Chalk Cliffs and Cottonwood Pass areas, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Other locations in the path of these storms include St Elmo and Alpine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft
